column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.DemoNERRE|NamedentityTags
#T_RL=webanno.custom.DemoRE|NamedentityRelations|BT_webanno.custom.DemoNERRE
#Text=A polycrystalline sample of LaO0.5F0.5BiS2 was prepared using high-pressure synthesis with a
#Text=cubic-anvil-type 180 ton press.
#Text=The starting materials are the La2S3 (99.9 %), Bi2O3 (99.99 %), BiF3 (99.9 %) and Bi2S3 powders and the Bi (99.99 %) grains.
#Text=The Bi2S3 powder was prepared
#Text=by reacting the Bi and S (99.99 %) grains.
#Text=The mixture with a nominal composition of
#Text=LaO0.5F0.5BiS2 was well-mixed and pressed into a pellet.
#Text=The sample was sealed into a BN
#Text=crucible and inserted into a high-pressure cell composed of a carbon heater, pyrophyllite cube
#Text=and electrodes.
#Text=The high-pressure cell was pressed with a pressure of 2 GPa and heated at 700
#Text=ºC for 1 hour.
#Text=The temperature dependence of the electrical resistivity (-T) was measured using
#Text=a four-terminal method under magnetic fields up to 14 T.
#Text=The magnetic field dependence of the
#Text=electrical resistivity (-H) in pulsed magnetic fields of up to ~ 56 T was measured by utilizing a
#Text=non-destructive pulsed magnet using the four-terminal method.
#Text=The duration of the pulsed
#Text=magnetic field was about 36 msec.
#Text=In the electrical resistivity measurements, the direction of
#Text=current was parallel to the applied magnetic fields.
#Text=The temperature dependence of the magnetic
#Text=susceptibility after both zero-field cooling (ZFC) and field cooling (FC) was measured using a
#Text=superconducting interference devise (SQUID) magnetometer with applied magnetic field up to 3
#Text=T.
